eu_initiatives:
All European Banking Authority (EBA) and the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) governance related initiatives: 
•  Joint ESMA and EBA Guidelines on the assessment of the suitability of members of the management body 
•  European Banking Authority (EBA) Consultation Paper Draft Guidelines on internal governance 
•  European Banking Authority (EBA) Guidelines on the remuneration benchmarking exercise 
•  European Banking Authority (EBA) Guidelines on the data collection exercise regarding high earners 
 
All European Central Bank (ECB) supervisory initiatives: 
•  Draft guide to Fit and proper assessments 
 
All banking legislation initiatives. 
 
All corporate governance initiatives. 
•  Shareholder Rights Directive 
 
The European Commission's Action Plan on company law and corporate governance.
membership: British Bankers' Association, International Corporate Governance Network, Member of the European Corporate Governance Institute, Institute of Directors.
goals__remit: To be the global leader in the provision of corporate governance services to financial institutions, companies and other organisations.
relevant_communication:
Jan 2017: Response to joint European Securities and Markets Authority and European Banking Guidelines on the assessment of the suitability of members of the management body 
Jan 2017: Response to European Banking Authority  Consultation Paper Draft Guidelines on internal governance 
Oct 2015:  Work in Progress: A report on the corporate governance of Europe's top 25 banks (Nestor Advisors report) 
July 2012:  Response to EBA Consultation Paper on draft Guidelines for assessing the suitability of members of the management body and key function holders of a credit institution 
July 2010: Response to EU Commission Green Paper – The EU corporate governance framework 
Oct 2015:  Response to the House of Commons Business, Innovation and Skills Commons Select Committee inquiry into corporate governance 
Sept 2015:  Response to the Prudential Regulation Authority’s consultation paper CP18/1:  Corporate governance – Board responsibilities 
Sept 2010:  Response to EU Commission Green Paper – Corporate governance in financial institutions and remuneration policies
